intro: Neobakeria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Neobakeria species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value. The leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the stems are often hairy and robust.
